item.title: Comment on USA fact of the day by Marie
item.description:
This is a reasonable point, but somewhat misleading.

1) A ton of work is done by contract employees, who are nominally employed by a contractor, rather than directly by the government.

(That is in addition to people employed indirectly through government contracts e.g. an engineer working for Raytheon, whose job is making Patriot missiles for the government or whatever.)

2) Even for direct employees, payroll is only a part of cost. Benefits, pensions, overhead and equipment probably close to double that.
